content.description: Sit-start on a pair of slopers, and traverse right past more slopers and pebbles to a straightforward but difficult topout.
content.location: This is located on the Muhly Boulder on its Southwestern flank.

content.description: Start on the right side of the boulder with a left hand undercling under the roof and a sloping righthand dish above the lip of the roof.  Compression moves take you out the arete to a very tricky and pumpy topout.  This one fights you till the very end.  Would have more stars if the rock quality were better....
content.location: This is on the Huhly Boulder on the east side of the Mountain Muhly trail.

content.description:
Scylla traverses the entire South side of the Muhly Boulder, starting at the beginning of

Wormhuhl

and continuing across

The Muhlinator

to a break at the Southeast corner, V6. If you continue around the Southeast corner and top out

Turbo Muhlet

, it checks in around V7. Three stars for Three Sisters easy!
content.location:
At the Southwest corner, find a pair of sloping holds that can be reached from a sit start (

Wormhuhl

). Top out at the Southeast corner at a hold that resembles the corner of a cube, along the right margin of the aforementioned break or crack. For extra Scooby snacks, monkey around the cap of the Southeast corner, and do the

Turbo

topout.

content.description: Sit start on the big fin-like jug on the left side of the 'V' boulder.  Fight your way up and right past two slopers to a jug and a mellow topout.
content.location: This is in the Muhly Boulders on the west side of the Mountain Muhly Trail.

content.description:
This route can be found around the back side of the boulder. Start the same as

Huhly Guacamole

on the small compression block, movercast up to the jugs, get high feet, and pull into an underling with right hand. Make some cool body movements, and mantel onto the platform. Top out above. This is also still a bit dirty.
content.location: It is on Huhly Muhly Boulder.

content.description: Start on two good angled crimps, toss to the sloper at the lip and make long moves out right and mantel. This is very fun for only being like 4 or 5 moves.
content.location: The Muhlinator is located on southwest, short, overhanging face of the Huhly Boulder on the east side of the trail.

content.description: Sit start in the middle of the 'V' boulder on two right-leaning underclings and make your way straight up, mantling over the bulge.
content.location: The Muhly boulders on the west side of the Mountain Muhly trail.

content.description: Sit start low on two opposing sidepull/crimps and make your way up through the crack and mantle over the small nose.
content.location: This is on the Muhly Boulders on the west side of the Mountain Muhly trail.

content.description:
Start as

Right Brain

on the juggy fin, but make your way up and left past the sloper and some crimps and a desperate toss to the lip and mantle over.
content.location: This is on the Muhly Boulders on the west side of the Mountain Muhly trail.

content.description:
Start as

Muhligan

on the underclings and make some moves upward, but start traversing right all the way to the nose and mantle up.  Surprisingly long for how small the boulder looks.
content.location: The Muhly boulders on the west side of the Mountain Muhly trail.

content.description: This climb can be found around the back side of the boulder. Start on a small compression block, make a big move up to good jugs, then setup and throw out left to a decent sidepull, toss up a heel, and come into an opposing sidepull. Find, feel, and throw out left to a good horn. Top out left out direct for a spicier topout (direct is still a bit dirty).
content.location: It is on the Huhly Muhly Boulder.

content.description:
Stand start with each hand on an under cling at head height, and smear your left foot on the face. Pull onto the wall, and make a big toss with your left hand to a good, flat, dish hold. Grab a good hold for the right hand, Â start sorting out the feet, and keep moving up to decent edges and slopers for the topout.

Given the height of the two underclings at the start, if you're shorter, you'll have to use another method to reach them.
content.location:
This is right of

Muhly Mantel

.
